PARAGRAPH.STRING: (Devanagari: भारत Bhārat), officially the Republic of India (Bhārata Gaṇarājya), is a country in South Asia.
is the seventh-largest country by geographical area, the second most populous country, and the most populous liberal democracy in the world.
has a coastline of over seven thousand kilometres, bounded by the Indian Ocean on the south, the Arabian Sea on the west, and the Bay of Bengal on the east.
borders Pakistan to the west;China, Nepal and Bhutan to the north-east; and Bangladesh and Myanmar to the east. In the Indian Ocean,
is in the vicinity of Sri Lanka, Maldives, Indonesia and Thailand.

Home to the Indus Valley Civilization and a hub of ancient trade routes, the Indian subcontinent became the seat of vast empires whose achievements include the decimal number system, the Buddhist art of Ajanta, and the Taj Mahal. Four major world religions, Hinduism, Buddhism, Jainism and Sikhism originated in
, while Islam, Christianity, Judaism and Zoroastrianism, arrived in the first millennium CE and shaped the variegated culture of
. Colonised by the British East India Company in the 18th century and directly administered by Great Britain starting the mid-19th century,
became a modern nation-state in 1947 after a struggle for independence marked by widespread use of nonviolent resistance as a means of social protest.
With the world's fourth largest economy in purchasing power and the second fastest growing large economy,
has made rapid progress in the last decade, most notably in information technology. A declared nuclear deterrent state, with an active space program,
is considered an emerging superpower. Although
standard of living is projected to rise sharply in the next half-century,
currently battles high levels of poverty, persistent malnutrition, and environmental degradation. A multi-lingual, multi-ethnicsociety,
is home to a diversity of wildlife in a variety of habitat consisting of evergreen forest, deciduous forest, desert, rain forest, and mangrove.
